address: 761, Janghang-dong, Ilsandong-gu, Goyang, Gyeonggi-do 410-380, South Korea

description: Bear City Ski Resort has the longest ski run in Korea recognized by the International Ski Association, less than an hour's drive from Seoul. The total length is 3.5 kilometers, with a total of 12 ski tracks. The equipment includes a snowboard playground, a ski school, a camp for 600 people, and a sauna. There is also a square-shaped ramp "Little Bear Ramp" specially built for beginners (slope 8 degrees, length 600×width 65m), where beginners can practice with confidence. The slopes are open to skiers, and there is a 400-meter long toboggan run for parents and children to ski together.

address: 53, Yangcheon-ro 47na-gil, Gangseo-gu | Gayang-1-dong, Seoul 07521, South Korea
